AP.name: Access Point Mode
AP.description: Wi-Fi setup mode used for SmartThings configuration.
AP.troubleshooting: Not a fault. Complete SmartThings setup or power-cycle the refrigerator to exit AP mode.

21E.name: Freezer Fan Error
21E.description: Freezer fan not operating properly due to icing or blockage.
21E.troubleshooting: Check for ice buildup around the fan, clear obstructions, inspect fan motor and wiring.

22E.name: Refrigerator Fan Error
22E.description: Refrigerator fan issue caused by obstruction or door left open.
22E.troubleshooting: Ensure door is fully closed, remove ice buildup, inspect fan motor and wiring.

22C.name: Refrigerator Fan Error
22C.description: Refrigerator fan issue caused by obstruction or door left open.
22C.troubleshooting: Ensure door is fully closed, remove ice buildup, inspect fan motor and wiring.

41.name: Family Hub Software Error
41.description: Family Hub display software or system malfunction.
41.troubleshooting: Power reset refrigerator. Update Family Hub software if available.

42.name: Family Hub Software Error
42.description: Family Hub display software or system malfunction.
42.troubleshooting: Power reset refrigerator. Update Family Hub software if available.

41C.name: Family Hub Update Error
41C.description: Software update failure on the Family Hub display.
41C.troubleshooting: Restart refrigerator and retry update. Verify network connection.

76C.name: Autofill Water Error
76C.description: Moisture or water detected in the autofill compartment.
76C.troubleshooting: Dry autofill compartment, check water supply lines and sensors.

85C.name: Low Voltage Warning
85C.description: Temporary voltage drop or power instability detected.
85C.troubleshooting: Ensure refrigerator is connected to a stable, dedicated power outlet.

88.name: Power or Voltage Error
88.description: Power surge or communication issue due to unstable voltage.
88.troubleshooting: Disconnect power for 5 minutes, then reconnect to a stable power source.

83E.name: Power or Voltage Error
83E.description: Power surge or communication issue due to unstable voltage.
83E.troubleshooting: Disconnect power for 5 minutes, then reconnect to a stable power source.

85E.name: Power or Voltage Error
85E.description: Power surge or communication issue due to unstable voltage.
85E.troubleshooting: Disconnect power for 5 minutes, then reconnect to a stable power source.

86E.name: Power or Voltage Error
86E.description: Power surge or communication issue due to unstable voltage.
86E.troubleshooting: Disconnect power for 5 minutes, then reconnect to a stable power source.

PC ER.name: Communication Error
PC ER.description: Communication failure between internal refrigerator components.
PC ER.troubleshooting: Inspect wiring harnesses between PCBs and power reset the unit.

PC CH.name: Communication Error
PC CH.description: Communication failure between internal refrigerator components.
PC CH.troubleshooting: Inspect wiring harnesses between PCBs and power reset the unit.

OF OF.name: Cooling Off (Demo Mode)
OF OF.description: Refrigerator is in showroom mode with cooling disabled.
OF OF.troubleshooting: Deactivate Demo Mode using control panel key combination.

O FF.name: Cooling Off (Demo Mode)
O FF.description: Refrigerator is in showroom mode with cooling disabled.
O FF.troubleshooting: Deactivate Demo Mode using control panel key combination.

OFF OFF.name: Cooling Off (Demo Mode)
OFF OFF.description: Refrigerator is in showroom mode with cooling disabled.
OFF OFF.troubleshooting: Deactivate Demo Mode using control panel key combination.

ALL_ICONS.name: Self Diagnostic Mode
ALL_ICONS.description: Normal startup self-test after power is restored.
ALL_ICONS.troubleshooting: No action required. Power-cycle unit if display does not return to normal.

ICE_OFF.name: Ice Maker/Bucket Error
ICE_OFF.description: Ice bucket missing or not properly seated.
ICE_OFF.troubleshooting: Reinstall ice bucket correctly and ensure ice maker is fully seated.

1E.name: Power Interruption Error
1E.description: Indicates a power outage or voltage interruption was detected.
1E.troubleshooting: Informational only. Verify stable power supply.

2E.name: Fridge Sensor Error
2E.description: Refrigerator temperature sensor is faulty or disconnected.
2E.troubleshooting: Inspect temperature sensor and wiring. Replace sensor if defective.

4E.name: Freezer Defrost Sensor Error
4E.description: Freezer defrost sensor failure affecting defrost cycle.
4E.troubleshooting: Check defrost sensor resistance and wiring connections.

5E.name: Fridge Defrost Sensor Error
5E.troubleshooting: Inspect defrost sensor wiring and resistance. Replace if faulty.

SE.name: Fridge Defrost Sensor Error
SE.troubleshooting: Inspect defrost sensor wiring and resistance. Replace if faulty.

6E.name: Ambient Sensor Error
6E.description: Ambient air temperature sensor is not functioning correctly.
6E.troubleshooting: Check ambient sensor placement, wiring, and resistance.

8E.name: Ice Maker Sensor Error
8E.description: Ice maker sensor failure or wiring issue.
8E.troubleshooting: Inspect ice maker sensor and wiring harness.

14E.name: Ice Maker System Error
14E.description: Ice maker system sensor is reporting an abnormal condition.
14E.troubleshooting: Power reset unit and inspect ice maker assembly and sensors.

26E.name: Water Valve Error
26E.description: Water inlet valve or ice maker water supply issue.
26E.troubleshooting: Check water supply line, inlet valve operation, and wiring.

33E.name: Ice Pipe Heater Error
33E.description: Ice pipe heater is not heating properly, risk of freezing.
33E.troubleshooting: Inspect heater resistance and wiring. Replace heater if needed.

39E.name: Ice Maker Function Error
39E.description: Ice maker operation or motor problem detected.
39E.troubleshooting: Inspect ice maker motor, gears, and wiring.

39C.name: Ice Maker Function Error
39C.description: Ice maker operation or motor problem detected.
39C.troubleshooting: Inspect ice maker motor, gears, and wiring.

40E.name: Ice Room Fan Error
40E.description: Ice room fan not operating correctly.
40E.troubleshooting: Check for ice blockage, inspect fan motor and wiring.

40C.name: Ice Room Fan Error
40C.description: Ice room fan not operating correctly.
40C.troubleshooting: Check for ice blockage, inspect fan motor and wiring.

84E.name: Compressor Lock Error
84E.description: Compressor motor is locked or unable to start.
84E.troubleshooting: Disconnect power, check compressor wiring, inverter PCB, and replace compressor if required.

84C.name: Compressor Lock Error
84C.description: Compressor motor is locked or unable to start.
84C.troubleshooting: Disconnect power, check compressor wiring, inverter PCB, and replace compressor if required.
